com.tokelon.toktales.core.render.texture

Interface ITextureDriver

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AndroidGLTextureDriver, GLTextureDriver

    public interface ITextureDriver
    Provides access to low level GPU functionality for managing textures.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void bindTexture(int textureLocation, int textureIndex)
      Binds the texture at the given location to the texture unit for the given index.
      int getMaxCombinedTextureUnits()
      Returns the number of texture units that are available on the GPU.
      int getMaxTextureSize()
      Returns the maximum texture size supported, in pixels.
      int getMaxTextureUnits()
      Returns the number of texture units that can be used for each state (vertex shader, fragment shader, etc.).
      int getTextureBoundToIndex(int textureIndex)
      Returns the location of the texture currently bound to the texture unit for the given index.
      int loadTexture(ITexture texture, int textureIndex)
      Loads the given texture via the GL onto the GPU.
      void unbindTexture(int textureIndex)
      Unbinds the texture on the texture unit for the given index.
      void unloadTexture(int textureLocation)
      Unloads the texture at the given location via the GL from the GPU.

    • Method Detail

      • loadTexture

        int loadTexture(ITexture texture,
                int textureIndex)
        Loads the given texture via the GL onto the GPU.
        Parameters:
        texture - The texture that should be loaded.
        textureIndex - The index of the texture unit that should be used for loading. Must be in range [0, getMaxTextureUnits()).
        Returns:
        The location (name) the texture was loaded to.

      • unloadTexture

        void unloadTexture(int textureLocation)
        Unloads the texture at the given location via the GL from the GPU.
        Parameters:
        textureLocation - The location (name) of the texture that should be unloaded.

      • bindTexture

        void bindTexture(int textureLocation,
                 int textureIndex)
        Binds the texture at the given location to the texture unit for the given index.
        Parameters:
        textureLocation - The location of the texture that should be bound.
        textureIndex - The index of the texture unit the texture should be bound to. Must be in range [0, getMaxTextureUnits()).

      • unbindTexture

        void unbindTexture(int textureIndex)
        Unbinds the texture on the texture unit for the given index.
        Parameters:
        textureIndex - The index of the texture unit that should be unbound. Must be in range [0, getMaxTextureUnits()).

      • getTextureBoundToIndex

        int getTextureBoundToIndex(int textureIndex)
        Returns the location of the texture currently bound to the texture unit for the given index.
        Parameters:
        textureIndex - The index of the texture unit that should be used.
        Returns:
        A texture location.

      • getMaxTextureSize

        int getMaxTextureSize()
        Returns the maximum texture size supported, in pixels.

        As an example, a value of 2048 would mean support for 2D textures up to 2048x2048 size.

        Note: This value is GPU dependent.

        Returns:
        The max texture size.

      • getMaxTextureUnits

        int getMaxTextureUnits()
        Returns the number of texture units that can be used for each state (vertex shader, fragment shader, etc.).

        Most of the time this should be at least 8.

        Note: This value is GPU dependent.

        Returns:
        The max texture units.

      • getMaxCombinedTextureUnits

        int getMaxCombinedTextureUnits()
        Returns the number of texture units that are available on the GPU.

        Note: This value is GPU dependent.

        Returns:
        The max combined texture units.
